thread.title: Think Philly's traffic is bad? Not compared to other cities
thread.title_full: Think Philly's traffic is bad? Not compared to other cities

author: Alison Burdo
title: Think Philly's traffic is bad? Not compared to other cities
text:
Enlarge 3dan3 Sitting on the Schuylkill Expressway during your commute this morning, you likely mulled how much of your life is spent sitting in traffic. But don't feel too sorry for yourself because Philadelphia is well behind many other major cites and smaller metros in congestion measures, according to a new report from the Texas A&M Transportation Institute . AC developer seeks millions in foreign investment The study shows Philadelphia ranks 22nd in yearly delay per commuter, wasting 48 hours annually due to congestion. The average for cities of a similar size is 63 hours wasted per year. The Inquirer reports Texas A&M Transportation Institute researchers say the rate of economic growth is related to the amount of congestion, and Philly's economy has not been growing as fast as other areas. For more details on the report, go to Philly.com .
